714002f-a.title: Manhattan: 59th Street (East) - 3rd Avenue
714002f-a.text:
2052207 East 59th Street, north side, )ust east of Third
Avenue. No. 207 is a two-story frame building with a stucco front.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 536.

714044f-a.title: Manhattan: 59th Street (West) - 3rd Avenue
714044f-a.text:
312-326 West 59th Street, south side, west of Columbus Circle.
Nos. 324-320 are all three-story frame buildings.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 214.

708106f-a.text:
Third Avenue, east side, north from No. 999 between 59th and 60th

April 21, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

708105f-a.title: Manhattan: 3rd Avenue - 59th Street (East)
708105f-a.text:
Third Ave., east side, north from but not including Fast 59th,
to and including 60th Streets.
June 16, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

708104f-a.title: Manhattan: 3rd Avenue - 59th Street
708104f-a.text:
Third Ave., south from East 59th Street, showing mainly the Third
Ave. Elevated Line. Across same appears the spire of the Chrysler Building.
This print has been roversed in the printing.
1936.
Gift of Dr. Michael Wishengrad, A.R.P.S.

713998f-c.title: Manhattan: 59th Street (East) - 3rd Avenue
713998f-c.text:
(1)
East 59th Street, east from and including Third Ave. Shown is
the 59th Street station of the Third Ave. Elevated. A portion of
Bloomingdale Bros. Dept Store, appears on the left.
JMne 11, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)  A portion ef the same, showing only the S.W. corner of East 59th
Street and Third Ave.
June 111, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
One month later, and showing the Bloomingdale Bros. Dept. Store,
thru clearance at the S.W. corner of East 59th Street and Third Ave.,
as seen from Third Ave.
July 11, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

714043f.title: Manhattan: 59th Street (West) - 3rd Avenue
714043f.text:
303-307, (garage) and 311 West 59th Street, adjoining and west of
the N.W. corner of Columbus Circle, showing the present (1937) site of
the Gotham National Bank Building being cleared. This included the vacant
1ot shown. The Rieser, No. 311, still stands. This set consists of a
Nnegative and a positive.
Between 1916 and 1922.
Cift of Albert a Volk Co.
